definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: The consignment scheduled for arrival here on 3rd May still has not reached us.
sentences.chinese: 預期在五月三日運交我方的貨物至今未到。

sentences.english: We beg to consign the following per S. S. London.
sentences.chinese: 請由“倫敦”號輪船運交下列各物。

sentences.english: The following goods are consigned to your address for arrival on 3rd March.
sentences.chinese: 三月三日下列貨物運交你方地址。

sentences.english: Consign these goods to Warner and Smith by express.
sentences.chinese: 把這批貨用快車運交華納和史密斯。

sentences.english: Please be assured that the order will be punctually fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 請放心，我方將準時運交訂單定貨。
